definition: to go over to the enemy/to defect
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: The officer was charged with selling out to the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 这位军官被指控背叛投敌。

sentences.english: The officer deserted to the enemy.
Dangerous driving should be severely punished.
sentences.chinese: 投敌者应受到严厉的惩罚。

sentences.english: A top ranking general defected to the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 一位最高级别的将军投敌了。

sentences.english: They spoke of people who had sold out to the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他们提到了那些背叛投敌的人。

sentences.english: Whoever will betray his country to the enemy will be condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 不论谁卖国投敌将会被判死刑。

sentences.english: Those who sell out to the enemy should be severely punished.
sentences.chinese: 投敌者应受到严厉的惩罚。

definition: breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
to rely on help from sb
greedy for life, afraid of death (idiom); craven and cowardly/clinging abjectly to life/only interested in saving one's neck
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to defect/to desert/to betray and flee
to change sides in a war/turncoat
